text: The National Marine Sanctuaries Act
label: HH2

text: •Congress mandated that national marine sanctuaries be
label: H3

text: managed to protect biodiversity and ecosystem components
label: H3

text: •Focus is on protection and management of natural habitats,
label: H3

text: populations, biological communities and ecological processes
label: H3

text: •The NMSA provides for a comprehensive and coordinated
label: H3

text: approach to conservation and management of special marine
label: H3

text: areas: ecosystem-based management
label: H3

text: •NMSA may complement single species management of the
label: H3

text: Magnuson-Stevens Act, the ESA and MMPA
label: H3

text: Impacts to ecosystem components in MBNMS
label: HH2

text: Natural and anthropogenic impacts to ecosystem components of the
label: H4

text: MBNMS
label: H4

text: Seasonal upwelling, El nino, climate change, etc.
label: H4

text: Pollution, invasive species, disease, destructive fishing practices
label: H4

text: (over fishing, trawling impacts to benthic environment), coastal
label: H4

text: development, aquaculture, etc.
label: H4

text: Tools to address impacts
label: H4

text: Water quality programs, effective fishery management practices
label: H4

text: (by the PFMC), marine zoning:
label: H4

text: MPAs to address impacts to ecological interactions among
label: H4

text: biological populations, communities, and their habitat, and future
label: H4

text: impacts to the system
label: H4

text: Use of complementary tools to reach multiple management objectives
label: H4

text: MPAs as a tool for
label: HH2

text: ecosystem-based management
label: H2

text: Research has shown that carefully crafted MPAs can be
label: H3

text: effective tools for maintaining and improving:
label: H3

text: Populations
label: H3

text: species diversity
label: H4

text: species number and size
label: H4

text: larger fish produce many more young that are healthier and
label: H4

text: more likely to survive
label: H4

text: Communities
label: H3

text: community structure such as trophic structure in foodwebs
label: H4

text: benthic habitat quality (more complex and heterogeneous)
label: H4

text: Ecosystems
label: H3

text: ecosystem productivity and stability
label: H4

text: ecosystem resiliency: ability to recover, resist and reverse natural and
label: H4

text: human disturbances
label: H4

text: serve as research areas to better distinguish between natural and
label: H4

text: anthropogenic perturbations to ecosystem components
label: H4

text: Existing Protections
label: HH2

text: EFH-RCA-MLPA
label: H2

text: Existing spatial management measures in state and federal waters of the
label: H4

text: Sanctuary provide valuable protections from impacts in certain habitats,
label: H4

text: but habitats further offshore are either:
label: H4

text: -Not adequately represented in existing MPAs, or
label: H4

text: - Not adequately protected by the gear based restrictions associated with
label: H4

text: EFH or the RCAs
label: H4

text: Fishery-based MPAs
label: H4

text: target single species - not ecological interactions
label: H4

text: of non target species and their habitat
label: H4

text: Existing MBNMS Zoning
label: HH2

text: Zones or MPAs are a not a new tool of spatial management for
label: H3

text: the MBNMS:
label: H3

text: • Certain human activities otherwise prohibited throughout the
label: H3

text: Sanctuary are allowed (motorized personal watercraft, harbor
label: H3

text: dredge disposal, jade collecting)
label: H3

text: • Certain human activities are specifically prohibited (shark
label: H3

text: chumming, low over-flights)
label: H3

text: MPAs in federal waters of the MBNMS
label: HH2

text: as an ecosystem-based tool to address
label: H2

text: Preservation of unique and rare areas in their natural
label: H3

text: state for the benefit of future generations
label: H3

text: • Preservation of areas where natural ecosystem
label: H3

text: components are maintained and/or restored
label: H3

text: Designation of research areas to differentiate
label: H3

text: between natural variation versus human impacts to
label: H3

text: ecological processes and components.
label: H3

text: ….unique and rare areas… ….for the
label: HH2

text: benefit of future generations
label: H2

text: The NMSA states that the NMSP will maintain for future
label: H3

text: generations the habitat, and ecological services, of the
label: H3

text: natural assemblages of living resources
label: H3

text: Intrinsic or inherent value: areas of unique and
label: H3

text: exceptional natural qualities
label: H3

text: Examples may include deep-sea coral and sponge
label: H3

text: communities, chemosynthetic biological communities
label: H3

text: Proactively steward special places within the MBNMS
label: H3

text: ….areas where natural ecosystem
label: HH2

text: components are maintained and/or restored
label: H2

text: Fishing activities have altered population abundances, and
label: H3

text: size and age structure of species, community composition,
label: H3

text: and habitat structure.
label: H3

text: Impacts of fishing on community and ecosystem structure
label: H3

text: still not well understood.
label: H3

text: Precautionary approach dictates setting aside a few areas
label: H3

text: where human activities are minimized to hedge against
label: H3

text: scientific and management uncertainty.
label: H3

text: Intact ecosystem components are also more resilient to
label: H3

text: natural and anthropogenic impacts.
label: H3

text: ….research areas to differentiate between
label: HH2

text: natural variation and human impacts ……
label: H2

text: •Developing an understanding of the interactions of living marine
label: H3

text: resources is key to effective management.
label: H3

text: •Setting aside areas of the Sanctuary as MPAs can provide critical
label: H3

text: research opportunities in offshore habitats in order to distinguish
label: H3

text: natural variation from human induced impacts
label: H3

text: •While the new MPAs in state waters do afford the opportunity to
label: H3

text: distinguish human induced change from natural variation,
label: H3

text: offshore habitats are not adequately represented
label: H3

text: The Decision - clarifications
label: HH2

text: •Was not a comment on existing conservative management measures
label: H4

text: by the PFMC - recent stock assessments show improvements to some
label: H4

text: fishery stocks.
label: H4

text: •Does not mean the MBNMS wants to manage fisheries - the CDFG and
label: H4

text: PFMC/NMFS manage fisheries.
label: H4

text: •Was made after an evaluation of current management measures,
label: H4

text: including supplemental information provided to the MBNMS by the
label: H4

text: ACSF, at meeting MBNMS MPA objectives
label: H4

text: •Included many hours of work by stakeholders, including scientists, on
label: H4

text: the MBNMS MPA working group
label: H4

text: •Process is coordinated with our local partners at CDFG, PFMC, NMFS
label: H4

text: •Affects only the federal portions of the MBNMS, not any other west
label: H4

text: coast sanctuary
label: H4

text: •Does not automatically require a change to the Designation Document
label: H4

text: Clarification of Purpose
label: HH2

text: The primary purpose for this decision is the protection of
label: H3

text: biodiversity and ecosystem components of the Sanctuary
label: H3

text: The immediate action is to evaluate opportunities for
label: H3

text: enhancing or modifying existing PFMC MPAs, or creating
label: H3

text: additional MPAs to meet MMNMS goals.
label: H3

text: Any future action would not be taken for the purpose of
label: H3

text: managing any single human activity or impact
label: H3

text: The Process Ahead
label: HH2

text: •Asking the PFMC and SAC for input on how best to build on
label: H3

text: the efforts of the MPA working group to ensure an effective
label: H3

text: and timely public process:
label: H3

text: – Attended the April PFMC meeting week of April 7, 2008
label: H3

text: – Coordinated with NOAA Fisheries in drafting the Rational
label: H3

text: for the MPA Decision
label: H3

text: •Asking for input on “Concepts for a Process” and proposed
label: H3

text: timeline (see handouts)
label: H3

text: Process Concepts (1-5)
label: HH2

text: The process ahead should capitalize on previous work
label: H4

text: The membership of the MPA working group should remain
label: H4

text: approximately the same, some adjustment may be warranted
label: H4

text: Science members should remain involved but serve as subject matter
label: H4

text: experts, not as stakeholders. A separate but public science panel
label: H4

text: should be convened to evaluate eventual proposals - include PFMC
label: H4

text: SSC members as part of science panel
label: H4

text: Working group meetings should be professionally facilitated
label: H4

text: Working group and science panel meetings should be public and any
label: H4

text: products made publicly available
label: H4

text: Process Concepts (6-11+)
label: HH2

text: The MPA planning process should provide for dialogue with and input
label: H4

text: from PFMC (prior to the NEPA phase and frequently)
label: H4

text: There is a need for socioeconomic study
label: H4

text: A starting point for discussions should be the Areas of Interest
label: H4

text: identified by the working group adjacent to MPAs in state waters
label: H4

text: Adjacent State and Federal  waters MPAs should generally have
label: H4

text: parallel regulations
label: H4

text: 10. The working group will have approx. 6 meetings over 6 months to
label: H4

text: develop proposals to forward to the SAC.
label: H4

text: 11. Decisions on implementing authority will be made in the future
label: H4

text: 12. Include a thorough characterization of existing protective measures as
label: H4

text: the status quo alternative and include the Davidson Seamount as part
label: H4

text: of the Sanctuary when developing the alternatives
label: H4

text: Use and protection of marine resource
label: HH2

text: “to facilitate to the extent compatible with the primary objective of
label: H4

text: resource protection, all public and private uses of the resources of
label: H4

text: these marine areas not prohibited pursuant to other authorities.”
label: H4

text: (Section 301(b)(6))
label: H4

text: This provision of the NMSA indicates that in the interest of
label: H4

text: facilitating public and private uses of sanctuary resources, resource
label: H4

text: protection is the primary objective and therefore takes precedence.
label: H4

text: Human uses and/or activities should be facilitated only where
label: H4

text: practicable in the context of resource protection.
label: H4

text: Vast portions (>98%)  of the MBNMS facilitate commercial and
label: H4

text: recreational extraction. Less than 2% is off limits to all forms of
label: H4

text: fishing in nearshore marine reserves implemented by the state.
label: H4
